postData.contentHtml:
Basic Syntax for Find command :find (name/size/type/access or modified date) ..argument ..argumentSearch for file ending .conf
find /etc/ -name *.confSearch for directories ending with *conf
find /etc/ -type d-name conf`**Search for files ending with .doc and accessed in last 24 hours(or 1 day)** find /home/xyzuser/ -name .doc -atime -1**Find files modified by minutes** Syntax : find /path/ -mmin**Find files 10 minutes ago** find /etc/ -mmin -10**Find files more then 10 minutes ago** find /etc/ -mmin +10**Find files modified between 10 to 20 minutes ago** find /etc/ -mmin +10 -mmin -20**Find files modified in past 2 days(48 hours)** find /etc/ -mtime -2**Search for files owned by xyz user** find /etc/ -type f -user xyz**Search for directories and change permission to 755** find /home/xyz.com/public_html/ -type d -exec chmod -v 755 {} \;`These are find command example used by every admin most frequently.
postData.title: find â€“ linux command cheat sheet
